data.title: Go for Lunch and Pick Up Dinner
data.text: Wonderful Italian sandwiches. While waiting, go browse the cold case for yummy dinner. dishes .  I recently picked up ravioli and a great jarred tomato sauce -- two birds with one stone!

data.title: Davis' Best Deli
data.text: Get a sandwich here ... you won't be disappointed. The sandwiches are nicely prepared and ample. Quality is high.

data.title: great Italian deli
data.text: I love to get thinly sliced coppa, salami, mortadella, and provolone during football season. Great food to eat while watching Notre Dame!

data.title: Delicious Italian Sandwiches!
data.text: Always super friendly staff - delicious side dishes and their desserts look amazing! The sandwiches are so good, the paninis are crunchy but not overly hard - perfection!

data.title: Always crowded becaúse it's so good.
data.text: Zia's has wonderful food products, and the sandwiches are excellent.  I really like the selection of Italian pastas to take home and cook.

data.title: Must try Lucca Sandwhich
data.text: I love this place soo much. The Lucca is such a classic sandwich that is fresh and tasty, I always order it on their soft french roll with the Sprecher Honey Root Beer.

data.title: Cute and good
data.text:
Nice Initial deli tucked into downtown Davis.  Nice display cases full of great looking salads, meats and entrees.  Tried the Lucca sandwich -lots of meat and fresh veggies.
Could easily return here to try some more....

data.title: Lovely Little Deli
data.text: Great fresh sandwiches. This would be an ideal place to pick up a picnic lunch! I highly recommend the Livorno sandwich.

data.title: Good local place for a nice sandwich
data.text:
We were wandering around downtown Davis and stumbled across Zia's.  The long line almost scared us off because we didn't want to wait long, but on the other hand there's usually a reason people are willing to wait.  Deciding to brave the line, we ordered a couple of sandwiches.  By the way, the line moved really quickly and the wait wasn't bad at all.  Neither were the sandwiches.  They came exactly as ordered, the meats were tender and fresh, the bread was also moist and fresh.  It was kind of funny in a way, when the gave us the sandwiches, wrapped in the traditional deli paper, they looked really small and flat and our first thoughts were for average priced sandwiches, these are really skimpy.  However, when we tore open the paper, they were really generous with the meats.  While they still weren't the biggest deli sandwiches I've ever had, they were certainly ample and did not leave us hungry.  As a matter of fact, they were just the right amount.

Although we didn't order any sides, the salads looked very good!  We did indulge in a cookie which was quite good and rounded off the lunch perfectly.  Bottom line, if you want a nice sandwich in downtown Davis, stop in at Zia's.  I think you'll be happy you did.

data.title: Absolutely the Best Sandwiches in Davis
data.text: We've been going to Zia's for years.  Their sandwiches are always good. Their prices are good.  You can select from their suggested sandwiches or can build your own.  The ingredients are top rate as is their bread. That's what differentiates their sandwiches from every other place.  Wish they had more vegetarian options, and yes, their space could be larger.  But Zia's is a family run restaurant, and I believe in supporting family run businesses.  Their desserts are delicious and very inexpensive. Try their salads, they are also good. Just a warning: their sandwiches are so large you may have to save the salads and desserts until later.

data.title: Good vegetarian sandwich options.
data.text: I had a nice caprese sandwich on a soft roll and I enjoyed it a lot. I would eat there again for sure. Staff was friendly too.

data.title: I really like this deli
data.text: This is a great deli in town.  The sandwiches are large and filling.  The service is excellent.  It's great to have an Italian style deli in town.

data.title: Always the very best
data.text: This little deli tucked into the darling streets of Davis never disappoints. There are wonderful unique Italian treats and food items that I regularly buy as gifts. But the sandwiches...... this is why we have eaten here for ~14 years! Try them all. Every single one is amazing. The energetic staff is always friendly and engaging, and they give excellent sandwich advice if you just can't pick one. Sit outside & enjoy the warm Davis air & lovely people passing by while you enjoy your lunch.

data.title: Small restaurant, good sandwiches
data.text: I was visiting with an extended family and this place was recommended by a local resident family member. Our problem was the seating. There are a few tables outside, and even less inside (maybe one or two personal tables). The service is also slow because they make your sandwich fresh when you order it, which then backs up the line. Most of our family was here when the line was shorter and were able to eat, but the remaining were starving and couldn't wait any longer. They ended up going across the street to Panera for the quick, but not as delicious sandwich. The sandwiches are wonderful, and on fresh bread. They will even custom make a kids sandwich to any specifications (type of cheese, sliced bread, etc). The pasta salads were also good- sold by the pound, or by size container. It was all worth the wait!

data.title: Excellent new for me lunch spot
data.text: I lost a bet with one of my students so it was her choice for lunch.  She picked Zia's.  I have lived in the area for a long time but have never tried Zia's before.  As soon as I arrived I knew it was going to be good based on the line out front.  It is a very popular lunch spot so get there before the lunch crowd.  I copied my student and had the Viageggio which was excellent.  I will be back.  It appears I need to lose more lunch bets to discover new lunch venues.  Thanks Leann for the pick.

data.title: Loved this place!
data.text:
Very quaint little cafe. Luckily, we happened to get there before the lunch rush and the person taking our order was very accommodating and eager to make us anything we wanted. She took extra time explaining what she could make for the kids. And even brought their sandwiches out first while my panini was being pressed.

The kids were especially impressed by Milo the cat who milled about out front. He seemed very friendly and loved their handouts.

The meat was all freshly cut ad seemed to be of good quality and tasted great!

data.title: Nice people, good food
data.text: We arrived a little early for lunch and had a short wait in line, but there was plenty of seating inside and out. I had the Luca & my wife had the Roma, both had generous portions of meat for such a modest price. The marinated artichokes tasted like homemade. Topped it off with an excellent expresso. There was a resident cat working the sidewalk cafe, really took us back to Rome.

data.title: No better sandwich in Davis
data.text: Zia's is consistently good.  I've never had a bad meal there, and I go once or twice a week.  The Roma is my favorite (on a soft roll!).  I've always found the staff to be very friendly.  Yes, it does get quite busy at lunchtime, but so does everywhere in downtown Davis. It's worth dealing with for the food, and it takes so long because they make everything fresh; they slice the sandwich meat as the sandwich is ordered--nothing is just sitting out for hours getting gross. Prices are super affordable...it's when you start adding things on that it gets expensive. The drinks/chips are overpriced, but I only ever go for the sandwiches, so that doesn't bother me! I've never personally tried the lemon bars, but a close friend tells me they are heavenly.

data.title: Best Davis sandwiches!
data.text:
I drive from Vacaville to get a sandwich at Zia's in Davis - enough said!
You must have the pesto mayo. To die for. 
Lots of goodies to buy in the deli also. Come prepared to be impressed!

data.title: Amazing sandwich, long wait at lunchtime
data.text: Zia's is by far the best sandwich in town but if you're looking for a sandwich at lunchtime during the week you'll have to wait a bit. Another option, if you're short on time, would be the Davis Co-op, which is a favorite of mine. But if you have the time Zia's is worth the wait. Or pick up a sandwich in the morning and eat it for lunch!
